description: From Latin accrescens, accrescentis, present participle of accrescere, from ad + crescere (“to grow”).

adjectives.description: accrescent (comparative more accrescent, superlative most accrescent)

examples: whose living growth is more and more conspicuous , and daily ornamented with new appearances of accrescent variety and alteration

entries.meaning: (botany) Which keeps growing past the point it normally would stop and begin wilting.
examples: The fruiting calyx is accrescent, covering all or most of the fruit.
